[Tristan]3029-tristan Fourteen days and fourteen nights . . . living without [her]2171-her . Without [them]2169-them . [I]3245-i sip [my]3245-i beer as [I]3245-i stare at the football game on the screen . [I]3245-i ’m in [the busiest American pub in [Paris]4-paris]2172-the busiest american pub in paris . [People]377-people are everywhere . [I]3245-i hear [their]377-people voices in the distance ; the echoes of [their]377-people jovial laughter fill the space . But [I]3245-i feel as if [I]3245-i ’m hovering above [them]377-people , not really here , not really there . In a detached state , cut . . . to the bone . If it were a physical injury , [I]3245-i would be in intensive care , barely clinging to life . The heart hurts more than any injury ever could . It beats weakly . . . barely at all . Every breath that [I]3245-i take feels like [my]3245-i chest is about to cave in . Every exhale a struggle . The walls have closed in , the dust has settled , and yet nothing has changed . [The world]265-the world is spinning at a million miles per minute , but the silence without [them]377-people . . . is deafening . [I]3245-i never knew what it felt like to lose [[someone]2335-someone [you]2176-you loved]2335-someone . A heartbeat that once [we]2177-we shared , [I]3245-i can no longer hear .
